articles.author: Rod Nickel
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney completed a comeback victory for the governing Liberals in Monday's election, positioning himself for a global role as a champion of multilateralism against U.S. President Donald Trump's more protectionist policies.
articles.title: Carney aims for global leadership role against Trump after Canada election win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Electricity had been restored to most of Spain and Portugal early on Tuesday after huge nationwide blackouts, although authorities were still trying to find out what caused the sudden outage.
articles.title: Spain, Portugal hunt for cause of power outage as electricity returns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said that Ukraine had not responded to many offers by Russia President Vladimir Putin to start direct peace negotiations, and that it was unclear whether it would join a three-day ceasefire he has announced for next month.
articles.title: Russia says it's waiting for Ukraine's response to May ceasefire and offer of direct talks

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: A predicted big win for Reform UK in local elections could see it become a credible right-wing force that could overtake the long-dominant Conservatives to become the main challenger to the governing Labour Party.
articles.title: New-look populist Reform party could reshape the UK political landscape

articles.author: David Ljunggren, Ismail Shakil, Rod Nickel
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberals staged a major political comeback to retain power in parliamentary elections, fuelled by a backlash against U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs and comments on making Canada the 51st U.S. state.
articles.title: Canada's Liberals benefit from Trump backlash to claim poll victory

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: The government of India's Jammu and Kashmir territory has decided to shut 48 of the 87 tourist destinations in Kashmir and enhanced security at the remaining ones.
articles.title: India shuts over half of Kashmir tourist spots in security review

articles.author: Ope Adetayo
articles.description: A surge in attacks in Nigeria's northeast by Boko Haram and its splinter rival ISWAP has raised fears of a major comeback by jihadists, whose tactics now include armed drones and explosive devices planted on major roads, security experts said.
articles.title: Surge in attacks signals jihadist comeback in Nigeria's northeast

articles.author: Mahmoud Hassano
articles.description: Syria's second largest city and a UNESCO World Heritage site, was deeply scarred by more than a decade of war between government and rebel forces.
articles.title: Lacking aid, Syrians do what they can to rebuild devastated Aleppo

articles.author: Mario Fuentes, Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Cuban mother Heidy Sanchez collapsed into tears as she recalled the moment last week when U.S. immigration officials in Florida told her she would be deported and separated from her still-breastfeeding 1-year-old daughter.
articles.title: Deported Cuban mother separated from breastfeeding 1-year-old daughter

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Pakistan is preparing international legal action over India's suspension of a key river water-sharing treaty, a government minister told Reuters, as tensions intensify between the neighbours following an attack on tourists in India-administered Kashmir.
articles.title: Pakistan preparing to challenge India's suspension of water treaty, minister says
